_header: O star of Jacob glory of Israel
Subjects: Virgin Mary, joys of; prayers, to Virgin Mary
_description: John Lydgate, ‘To Mary the Star of Jacob’, an orison to the Virgin Mary of the Five Joys — seven stanzas rhyme royal with refrain, ‘Aue maria’

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
O sterre of Iacob and glorye of Israellof alle blissed O blyssedest
                    vyrgyne…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…While I þi servaunt haue hem in remembraunceageyn
                    goostly enmyes to stonde in assuraunce
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: HEre is a praier to our lady of hir v Ioies (f. 29v)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 1.282-4.

BodLye30.First Lines:
O lady sterre of iacob glorie of israelOff all blessis o blessedist
                    virgine…
BodLye30.Last Lines:
…While i thi seruant haue hem in remembraunsA yeyne goosty
                    enemyes to stode in assurauns
BodLye30.Attributed Title: Oracio de sancta maria in anglicis verbis (f.176)

CamSidney37.First Lines:
O Sterre of iacob gliorie of israelOf alle blessed o blessedest
                    virgine…
CamSidney37.Last Lines:
…While I thi seruant hem In remembransAgayne alle gostly
                    enmyes to stonde in assurans

CamTCC601.First Lines:
o sterre of Iacob glory of IsraellOf all blyssyd o blyssedyst
                    virgineffor that tydynges whyche that GabriellBrought vnto the most
                    heuynly and dyuyne…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Whyle I thy seruaunt haue hem in remembraunceAgayn gostly
                    enemyes to stond in assuraunce

BLHar372.First Lines:
O sterre of Iacob glorye of IsraellOf all blissed O blisseddest
                    virgine…
BLHar372.Last Lines:
…whil I am thi seruaunt haue hem in RemembraunceAgayne gostely
                    enmyes to stonde in assuraunce
BLHar372.Note:
Penultimate stanza has spaces left for insertion of missing words in
                    lines 4-6, perhaps because exemplar was damaged at this point.
